page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area in general is not bery high, the highest hill in the area is Welshie law at five hundred and four feet. There are several fields under crop in the south east quarter. There are also houses and farms in the south east quarter. The only populated area. The land in the other quarters is basically dry moor and heath. Through this populated area runs the A708, and the Yarrow water alongside it. There are some earth works in the south west corner. About a hundred yards from the A708 stands the yarrow stone, grave of two princes, and although the epitaph is weathered away, faint lines are still deciferable. There is quite a lot of enclosed pasture visible There are two burns, the Wurlus and the Whitehope which run into the Yarror water.
